Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Glucose enters the pores of ZIF-8, leading to oxidation and pH reduction.

Other Information.Additional Info: Glucose-responsive insulin release occurs due to the acidic byproducts of glucose oxidation disrupting ZIF-8.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Insulin release: 137.2 μg/mL (normoglycemic, 1 mg/mL glucose), 448.9 μg/mL (hyperglycemic, 4 mg/mL glucose)

Other Information.Additional Info: Encapsulation efficiency of insulin was nearly 100%, with enhanced loading via microfluidic synthesis.
